channel.title: Text Mining TEL Blogs 2013-04-29
channel.description: Scanning TEL Blogs for the most significant posts with economic, political or legal topics from the 14 days prior to 29 Apr, 2013 .

item.title: 25% find company training/e-learning of no value – according to the Learning in the Workplace 2013 survey results.
item.dc:creator: Learning in the Social Workplace
item.description: The Learning in the Workplace Survey has now been taken by over 600 people, and although it is still open if you want to cast your vote, I am going to release some interim findings here today as the pattern of results has been pretty stable for some time now. The survey asked respondents to rate the importance (value/usefulness) of 10 different ways of learning for themselves. The red figures are where the most responses have been received. Not important Quite important Very importa...

item.title: Australia – educating globally
item.dc:creator: bluyonder
item.description: On Friday, the Age newspaper featured a story on how foreign fee paying students have become a lucrative income source for cash-strapped Victorian schools. It’s coincidental because I’ve just caught up reading the February report by the International Education Advisory Council on the challenges and opportunities of Australia’s international education sector. While the focus is predominately on expanding tertiary and VET sectors, there are some interesting statistics on the d...

item.title: Dr. Paul LeBlanc to Open NUTN Network 2013 Conference
item.dc:creator: Virtual School Meanderings
item.description: From Thursday’s inbox… Having trouble viewing this email? Click here NUTN Network 2013 Opening Keynote September 16-18, 2013 | Albuquerque, New Mexico CALL FOR PRESENTATIONS open until May 3. We want to hear from you. Dr. Paul LeBlanc to open Network 2013 conference. With LeBlanc at the helm, Southern New Hampshire University has become a trendsetter and perhaps one of the most dis...

item.title: Open Standards Board and the Cabinet Office Standards Hub
item.dc:creator: Adam's Work Blog
item.description: Early last week the government announced the Open Standards Board had finally been convened via a press release from Francis Maude, the Minister for the Cabinet Office, and via a blog post from Liam Maxwell, the government's Chief Technology Office. This is a welcome development but what chuffed me most was that my application to be a Board member had been successful. I say "finally" because it has taken quite a while for the process to move from a shadow board and a consultation on policy (C...

item.title: 2013 Annual Meeting Preview
item.dc:creator: Virtual School Meanderings
item.description: From yesterday’s inbox… April 24, 2013 AERA Responds to Call for Hyatt Boycott AERA President Bill Tierney and Executive Director Felice Levine respond to notification that a number of Annual Meeting attendees were calling on the Association to boycott the Grand Hyatt San Francisco, one of AERA’s six headquarter hotels for the 2013 Annual Meeting. Read more President Tierney to Address the Role of the Intellectual in Eliminating Poverty In his presidential ad...
